Line 3: Line 3:
'''Datangshan''' is the site of the biggest [[aviation museum]] in [[China]]. Most people call it Datangshan, but the correct name is '''China Aviation Museum'''. Datangshan is actually the name of the mountain (hill) which is the main landmark in the area. Part of the museum is located inside this hill in a cave, which originally was part of the tunnel and underground bunker system of the Shahe [[Airbase]] in [[Changping District]], with the road leading to the museum is actually a taxiway from the [[airbase]] to the museum.
'''Datangshan''' is the site of the biggest [[aviation museum]] in [[China]]. Most people call it Datangshan, but the correct name is '''China Aviation Museum'''. Datangshan is actually the name of the mountain (hill) which is the main landmark in the area. Part of the museum is located inside this hill in a cave, which originally was part of the tunnel and underground bunker system of the Shahe [[Airbase]] in [[Changping District]], with the road leading to the museum is actually a taxiway from the [[airbase]] to the museum.
â
The China Aviation Museum was opened to the public on [[November 11]], [[1989]] to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of the Founding of the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force|PLA Air Force]], to an astonished reaction from the aviation community in the outside world, who had no idea of the wealth of aviation history preserved in the country. With a huge number of 200 aircraft on display, including many unique machines, this is a must see place for every aviation enthusiast. Entrance fee is [[Renminbi|RMB]] [[Â¥]]45. +
The China Aviation Museum was opened to the public on [[November 11]], [[1989]] to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of the Founding of the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force|PLA Air Force]], to an astonished reaction from the aviation community in the outside world, who had no idea of the wealth of aviation history preserved in the country. With a huge number of 200 aircraft on display, including many unique machines, this is a must see place for every aviation enthusiast. Entrance fee is [[Renminbi|RMB]] [[Â¥]]45.
